subject: Art
title: Hatching & Crosshatching
description: Building value with parallel and crossed lines.

hook.text: Grab any dollar bill â€” that portrait is rendered entirely with tiny parallel lines. Hatching and crosshatching can create every value from white to black using nothing but lines.

buildup.text: Hatching: parallel lines create value. Closer lines = darker. Farther apart = lighter. Crosshatching: add a second layer of lines at a different angle. Each layer darkens the value.

discovery.text: Line direction matters: lines that follow the form's contour (contour hatching) make objects look three-dimensional. Straight horizontal hatching flattens. Curved hatching creates volume.

twist.text: Crosshatching builds value gradually. You can go darker by adding layers, but you can't go lighter. Start light and build up â€” it's easier to add darkness than to remove it.

climax.text: Draw a sphere using only hatching: light parallel lines on the light side, progressively denser lines into the shadow. Add crosshatching for the darkest core shadow.

punchline.text: Lines aren't just edges. They're values. Hatching is how lines create light.

quiz.question: How does crosshatching differ from hatching?
options: Crosshatching adds overlapping line layers at different angles to create darker values
